intro: Tithymalus desertorum, commonly known as the desert tithymale, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with its deep root system and succulent leaves that store water. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its resilience, it is often used in xeriscaping and as a drought-tolerant ornamental plant.
